alert.note: Alert for Los Alamos; Santa Fe (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 20 at 7:34PM MDT until further notice by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory continues for the following rivers in New Mexico... Rio Chama Above Abiquiu affecting Rio Arriba County. Rio Grande Near San Ildefonso Pueblo affecting Los Alamos and Santa Fe Counties. Rio Grande At Rio Grande at Embudo affecting Los Alamos, Rio Arriba and Santa Fe Counties. Embudo Creek Below Dixon affecting Rio Arriba County. .Warm temperatures have melted snowpack and increased river flows. ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...High flows and minor overbank flooding is expected due to rain and snowmelt. * WHERE...Rio Grande near San Ildefonso Pueblo. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 9.0 feet, Flooding of cultivated lands upstream of the Otowi gage will increase if water levels rise further. Fast flowing water could undermine the river banks. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:00 PM MDT Saturday the stage was 8.3 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to remain steady below flood stage at 8.3 feet. - Action stage is 8.0 feet. - Flood stage is 9.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: To report flooding, contact your local law enforcement agency and your National Weather Service office when you can do so safely. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/abq. The next statement will be issued Sunday morning around 1000 AM MDT.
